website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic pick for buyers looking for an exceedingly popular, reliable massage ball.
pros: Work wonders for relieving tense, sore muscles, and knots
Customers rave over this product's effectiveness, claiming the durable rubber lasts for years
Company provides a money-back guarantee within 30 days
cons: Many customers claimed the product had an unpleasant rubber smell

customer_reviews.title: Balls feel great
customer_reviews.text: I don't always drag balls across my back for pleasure and relief but whe. I do, I drag Kieba's balls.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G.

customer_reviews.title: relieves tension
customer_reviews.text: i have chronic neck and should pain due to computer work and stress. i can't afford massages all the time so these help. they are harder than tennis balls so if you prefer deep tissue massage, then these will benefit you. if you are too sensitive for deep tissue, these might be too hard for you.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Really hits the trigger points easily with very little effort
customer_reviews.text: so many choices, which one to choose? Price was right, looking for sciatica trigger point release. My first experience with lacrosse massage balls. It's been a positive experience. Really hits the trigger points easily with very little effort. I knew within 5 seconds of using them, that it was going to be successful. I let my wife try them after her work day and after 5 seconds she could feel the lacrosse massage balls hitting trigger points very effectively. This is a very worthy purchase! Another friend wanted to know if it left marks on the wall, and that hasn't seem to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pokie

customer_reviews.title: Stiff, yet softly padded
customer_reviews.text: They're certainly comfortable. Perhaps a bit too comfortable. I remember a friend letting me use her lacrosse balls to try them out. The were solid and my feet felt like they were in heaven. These balls, on the other hand have a softer exterior. That might be a plus to some, though. Best description I can give is the firmness of a racquetball exterior (or like those little bouncing rubber balls sold in coin machines). If that's the feel you like--and not a solid, rigid shell--then this is right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Concepcion

customer_reviews.title: TOXIC CHEMICAL SMELL THAT DOES NOT GO AWAY. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: These balls are terrible with a TOXIC CHEMICAL SMELL. They smell awful and the smell does not go away, even after washing. This is not the lacrosse ball standard—the ones I already have from official lacrosse ball vendors are completely odorless. It is irresponsible to be selling this product, as it is surely bad for the environment. Please stop selling this type, as that supports their production. Anyone who has seen the netflix documentary Stink knows that sometimes items from China include cancer-causing chemicals that are banned in Europe and the US. I bet these have them. The balls are completely unusable, smell so bad! Cancer balls!
customer_reviews.author: Eye of Harmony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on the spot Foot Massagers!
customer_reviews.text: Have your feet ever felt constricted, tight, or like they needed a massage? That’s what I love about these balls - immediate tension release! Who has time for on the spot, last second, quick, foot massages?! Not even the movie stars! That’s where these balls come in to the picture - instant foot relief from the daily tensions of the world. What I like: 1. VERY durable (able to withstand a lot of weight and not flimsy or hollow) 2. Not soft, but also not hard like a rock, sort of like very tough rubber. 3. Small enough that I can leave them in the corner and rub my feet on them when my feet are tense.
customer_reviews.author: MarkToMarket

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my personal trainer suggested getting a lacrosse ball to help with some knots in my shoulders and my hips. These balls are amazing! I like using them the best by laying on the floor and finding the knot on my back and applying pressure that way. I have only had them a few days and have already broken two huge knots in my shoulders! I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for relief from knotted or tight muscles. They are easy to use and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: They smell
customer_reviews.text: These are super weird and have a bizarre smell to them that no other lacrosse ball has had in the past. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: These balls are heavy, but good for their use - massaging muscle soreness.
customer_reviews.text: The balls are of lovely color and great for their use. However, I was a bit surprised to find out how heavy the balls were. I didn't realize that Lacrosse balls are the heavy ones, and you also have light massage balls that are squeezable. Initially I was looking for the latter and bought the heavy ones instead, because I didn't do the search carefully enough. So do your search correctly before buying any massage ball. Aside from my stupid mistake, I actually like these balls and discovered that they have their own use as well. Not good for throwing and catching of course due to their heavy weight, but great for massaging sore areas in your muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Dong S. Park

customer_reviews.title: My back says thanks!
customer_reviews.text: If you wanna see your coworker act like a stripper dancing on a pole, only the pole is the wall and they are not stripping naked, then introduce them to this. You'll see them swirling around on the wall with the satisfaction on their face. Great time! Or you can lend them one of the ball and go around and say I gave Dave (a) blue ball. lol All joke aside, this is a great product! Solid and just the right size! I tried a golf ball before, it hurt so much. But these balls are just right! Love them! The rubber surface could get dirty if you use it on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Linh D.

customer_reviews.title: Unusable because of horrible rubber smell
customer_reviews.text: They are not as sturdy as the balls our instructor uses in class but do the job. The only thing that make them practically unusable for me is the horrible chemical/rubber smell. I tried washing them and leaving them outside to air out but they still smell horribly. I was trying to save money with these but have to buy the more expensive ones after all because I know those don’t have the smell and come with a pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: If you have Plantar Fascistic
customer_reviews.text: Freeze a Waterbottle and roll your arch on that frozen waterbottle and you will be miles better for it. I've tried rolling on a ball plenty of times with different sizes and materials, nothing beats the water bottle method in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Iyiahn

customer_reviews.title: Next step up from tennis ball...
customer_reviews.text: The balls are super hard, i would recommend trying a tennis ball before ordering this item. I’m sure it would benefit others, it just wasn’t for me. The tennis ball on the other hand is softer and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Campanaro

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest way to unkink your body
customer_reviews.text: Since going out to get a massage is a lot more riskier than how it used to be, I decided to go back to these balls. Working from home with the same position all day will definitely break your body. My whole back was tight and started to feel the pain. However, with these rolling around the perimeter of the spine, it makes a world of difference. Good for glutes also. Think about going to the massage vs purchasing this for couple of bucks. I personally gained an amazing results with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Best muscle relief ever
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have ever made. My lower back was hurting so bad I couldn’t think straight. I had some massages but they can’t feel your body like you can. With these I was able to pinpoint my knots and really hold the pressure on them like I needed. I feel like a new person now after being able to release the knots. Now I can knock them out before they become debilitating. Trust me you need these in your life especially if you exercise or lift weights.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy G

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Must be me, but I found these hard balls super painful to use. I have knots in my shoulders and thought I could lay on these balls to loosen up my tight muscles. I couldn’t; the balls were just too hard and it was really painful. Oh well; I’ll have to find someone who plays lacrosse to give them to.
customer_reviews.author: D from NY

customer_reviews.title: Roll with it, your body will thank you.
customer_reviews.text: As a massage therapist, I am always on the lookout for self-care items. These Kieba balls are a goldmine. You can self-massage with desired pressure by using a wall surface. Works really well on the rhomboids (upper back) and gluteals for lower back pain and achiness. Check out how to effectively use them on paintopia.com. Gave one to a client who has chronic upper back pain from tight muscles. Downside, is my client's can get relief without coming in to see me. This works so well, thinking of buying one for all my therapist co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: DoogieMom

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I recently got these last week but so far my mobility had improved. I have really bad ankles and I walk alot on my job. I used these to roll on my feet standing up to release some tension in them. I also use it for my calves since I train 3 hours straight in Muay Thai. On one particular day we had a crazy kettlebell training day and my quads cramped up really bad. Good thing I had the kieba ball to release some of the muscles that were cramping. After laying in them for about 3mins on the part that hurted it was fine. Good buy if you do hardcore training.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Gives off a chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: These are very firm and seem good quality. The only down side is I slept with one by my bedside, in my nightstand drawer (I left it cracked open), and woke up thinking "something smells like salt..." and then thought "and ammonia or something". I got out of bed at 5am and started sniffing everything until I found the culprit; the single ball I left in the night stand. I'll be returning and looking for something a little softer and without the chemical smell... yikes...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Within the first few seconds of using these, I was amazed at how many knots I really had that I didn't even know about. I'm only a few days into using them, but I can already tell how much they're helping loosen up my tight back muscles. I use them against the wall, with no marking effects whatsoever. I tried using them while laying on the floor, but the wall works much better for me. I would recommend these for self-massage. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: mx219

customer_reviews.title: Its like a deep tissue massage
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE THINGS. I get a super tight neck and upper shoulders from working out and sitting at a desk all day. I use the balls to massage out my shoulders and upper back all the time and it does wonders for me!!! they have saved me a lot of money because I don't need massages nearly as often. When I get stiff I can work it out. Only down side is its kinda tuff trying to get your neck but its doable.
customer_reviews.author: Abbi

customer_reviews.title: This little ball packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as they were recommended by my physical therapist following a car accident in which I was rear ended. During my appointments, he would work into some of my pain points, which really helped to relieve the pain. Unfortunately, my wife was unable to apply the same amount of force at home. I am able to use these to relieve my back pain and work into some of the pain points that I still have. This has been a wonderful purchase and has really helped me to feel better in my day to day life.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: stink
customer_reviews.text: These balls have a terrible odor. They are in a double sealed plastic bag and not being used because of the odor.
customer_reviews.author: clair rose

customer_reviews.title: My only suggestion is to be sure to get at least two because it is easy to lose one and they are too indispensable to ...
customer_reviews.text: My second set. I gave one away and lost one of my first pair. My only suggestion is to be sure to get at least two because it is easy to lose one and they are too indispensable to be without. Great to relieve muscle tension in massage. Was turned on to using lacrosse balls for self-massage from Kelly Starrett of Mobility WOD. He has lots of free info on the web and a great bookwhich I also highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Schopp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for rolling the bottom of my feet to combat plantar fasciitis. For my women's size 10 feet these are a great size. Firmness is perfect for massaging those awful knots without killing your foot in the process. Also love the slightly tacky material, it rolls easily but doesn't go flying across the room if you accidentally slide your foot too hard off of it. I keep one at home and one at my desk at work, massage 5 minutes per foot every few hours, and it has TREMENDOUSLY improved my foot pain. Hopefully another few weeks of these balls and it'll be banished for good!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Same quality as the one we received in Physical Therapy!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter suffered a partial Achilles tear due to stiffness in her muscles, PT told her to use these daily to relieve pressure points but only provided her with one, Amazon to the rescue! These are the same quality as the prescribed, medical grade ball we paid out the nose for from the therapist. They are now in all of her sports bags and easily replaced if she loses one. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Queensley

customer_reviews.title: Smells like my car’s tires
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and returned. These are made of cheap rubber. They have a toxic rubber smell like my car’s tires. Rubbing on these is like rubbing on my car’s tires. The smell gets all over me and my clothes. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tulip

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but good things about these Lacrosse Balls
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about these massage lacrosse balls. I don’t get how some people complain about the smell, “HELLO” it’s rubber. What did you think it was about to smell like....JuiceyFruit and JellyBeans? The smell disapates within a week after opening. These are just right for rolling out my traps, hams, calves, chest, arms and good for feet rolling after a good run or hike. A very firm rubber that gives just a little when pressure is applied but still keeps it’s firmness to hit the areas you are targeting.
customer_reviews.author: iMuscle

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product but depends on the user.
customer_reviews.text: I feel the features that can be rated are not at all fair because they depend on the user and the expertise each one has. I will give my "normal user" review: these balls have some weight on them, I had no idea they are somewhat heavy but I love that feature. When using them, they really hit the point I am trying to massage and they have helped me to release some trigger points. Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: H. H. di Firenze

customer_reviews.title: High quality lacrosse balls for myofascial release!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lacrosse balls as a modality to use in conjunction with my stretching exercises. They are high-quality balls that are very durable, hard, and get the job done. It's a bit difficult to give a heavy analysis (pros/cons) on an item such as this, but it is exactly as described and a great choice whether your intention is myofascial release, massage techniques, or even lacrosse!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: feels SO good on your feet!
customer_reviews.text: i initially bought these because i foam roll a lot and a friend recommended these as a more "intense" foam roll. it is INTENSE but i love every second of it. at first, when i was rolling these balls on the bottom of my feet i couldn't even put half my weight into it. now, i can stand on the ball full weight and roll out and it isn't painful anymore! i also use it to roll my calves and butt. good to keep one under your desk to be able to roll out your feet at all times
customer_reviews.author: Andes Le

customer_reviews.title: Lacrosse Balls
customer_reviews.text: I was told to buy tennis balls but brought these 2 balls instead, they may work for something else but not for my pain. They were too hard for me, not soft like a tennis ball, it made my pain worse, so I will be buying 2 tennis balls. It's possible that I didn't use them correctly but in any case, I won't be using them for my pain so I can't really give a good review on these balls.
customer_reviews.author: Willie M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Pain reliever
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a hip replacement and was having spasms in my buttocks. My physical therapist recommended the lacrosse ball for pain relief. I was using them in therapy and found them to be useful, therefore; I purchased them for home use. I have found them to be quite useful, but please use on a firm surface. I have not used them for any other purpose other than rocking back and forth on the ball to relieve the spasm in my buttock. As my pain is relieved and I begin to use them in other ways, I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Keep it rolling..
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it hurts but it also heals. I think this is one of the best healing method for my ailing feet & legs. I highly recommend this product - any brands would do. My feet felt tired at times, legs felt heavy. My sports doc recommended these balls. Pretty simple, just step on one of the balls, keep rolling your foot with a bit of pressure, side to side, circular motion, until you find the aching point. Concentrate on that, keep the circular motion, every day. I see the result in just day #3. Now, I can jump higher and run with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pressure Points
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these to relieve a lot of tightness on my shoulders and they are getting all the right spots! So far, the tightness has been getting better to deal with and having these lacrosse balls helps a lot. Just like a regular sized lacrosse ball, they are very easy to carry around that I always carry one with me to the gym. I usually just get on a wall or on the floor and apply pressure directly on my knots and they work wonderfully! This is definitely a product to get if you are in need of a knot removed in hard to get locations by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great for full body massage
customer_reviews.text: Pic for size reference. Now I can't live without these. I have them lying around next to the couch and we massage our feet with them. Every friend who tried these are surprised by how awesome it feels. It only had a very strong chemical smell in the beginning and took some time to go away.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: These are great, they serve their purpose for sure! If you want a deep tissue massage as apposed to a soft massage then these are the ones. If you want a softer massage then you should try racquet ball or even a tennis ball. These are my favorite for massages so far. I use them on my neck and upper back and can definitely tell a difference compared to tennis or racquet balls. They do have a bit of a chemical odor but it’s not terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrold-Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: These have been a life saver. Bought them because I had these tight muscle in my upper back/traps. I get on the floor and roll these over all the nooks and crannies. SUCH A RELIEF! Also I've got some tight hips, and I roll these over my glutes which provide much pain relief. A standard foam roller is sometimes too big to get those very specific spots and I found these to work really well. A+
customer_reviews.author: GoldBullion

customer_reviews.title: Astounding pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely skeptical about this product, but in desperation to find more drug free options for pain relief I gambled on this purchase. I was shocked to discover how much they really help. I put both balls in a sock and tied the end. It works awesome on my lower back and I can literally feel my endorphins kicking in when I roll around on the floor with them. I can use them on my neck, but reaching my shoulders is a little more difficult. But, for the price, 100% worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel A. Eager

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, worth having around
customer_reviews.text: These are very stiff rubber balls that are a great size for rolling with your hand. They seem to be high quality and don't have a chemical stink to them. If you haven't had a chance to use something like this you will be surprised by the amount of relief you can get from a simple rubber ball. Personally I use them on my lower back and half sit on them to help relieve lower back pain, sometimes the pain is from tight glute muscels which I get a lot from sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Nawerd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Plantar fasciitis exercise.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a friend who was diagnosed with Plantar fasciitis. His Podiotrist recommended rolling a ball under his foot nightly as a way to alleviate the pain he was suffering with. These have helped so much! My friend kept putting off getting this regimen started until i gifted him these and now he is pain free most days. Nice to get a two pack so that he can keep one at the office and use it while he is at his desk. I would recommend these for the price, the firmness and the convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Really does provide relief!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but this really does help with a nerve issue in my shoulder blade that causes pretty bad neck pain for me. Leaning against a wall or just lying on the floor with the ball pressing into the inflamed nerve in my shoulder blade is very very helpful. Definitely a good economical alternative to a much more expensive massage.
customer_reviews.author: JohnC

customer_reviews.title: High quality and wonderful massage tools
customer_reviews.text: These massage balls are perfect for working those trigger points and muscle knots. I find them to be the perfect tools for rolling over the outside of my hips and breaking up the painful fascia there. The first few times I used them, the areas I worked were very sore for a day or so afterward, but as I persisted in using them, the soreness dissipated and those areas are now more flexible, smooth and free of pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jazminjo

customer_reviews.title: Piriformis soreness relief
customer_reviews.text: The ball works extremely well for getting at the piriformis muscle. I've used foam roller and it helps with the piriformis too, but not like the ball. The piriformis is deep in the hip and hard to find and stay on with a roller. I can find the sore spot much easier with the ball and stay on it. It's painful when you let the ball penetrate the sore muscle, but the effects were dramatic and immediate. There are probably a lot more applications for the massage ball, but if it did nothing else it would be well worth having just to alleviate hip soreness.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: My massage therapist gave me a sort of big bouncy ball to use for trigger point release. It worked but I needed something larger to get into some areas deeply enough. THESE! These are perfect. They work on my back, neck, hips, glutes... And they have nice rubber so that they grip the wall a bit.
customer_reviews.author: MissK

customer_reviews.title: These things have been a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I usually struggle to find something that gets into the trouble areas of my back and shoulders while I am relaxing in bed. These fit perfectly and comfortably and help to relieve the tension in the knots that cause numbness and tingling in my arm. I can also use them while leaning against a wall or laying on the floor. They get the job done! I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for massage...
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended these for shoulder pain. I am on a computer all day long, all week long. By the end of the week I have huge knots in my shoulders. My wife will roll these over the knocks with minimal effort and it hits the spot! Her hands are too weak to really get in there so these balls really come in handy. My only advice would be to apply minimal pressure to build tolerance because you will hurt yourself. It simulates a deep tissue massage.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: I love them, I purchased extra to put in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love them, I purchased extra to put in my plate to give me the ability to relieve knots in other parts of my back. I would trade the relief I get now. Before my back would be in knots and I coudln't walk or lie down and get any rest, but now my sleep has improved so much.I definitely would recommend this product if you have sciatic nerve problems because it relieves deep tissue knots for a great relief.
customer_reviews.author: tessy

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: The massage balls are very sturdy and of great quality. They are exactly what I was looking for to release huge knots I have in my upper arms where I can use them against a wall because I live by myself. Works like a charm.... painful as hell, but that means its working!!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Helped relax my back pain.
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic medium level lower back pain. I often have trouble sleeping because of the pain. I used the therapeutic balls, in bed before going to sleep. It helped me immensely. Painful at first but eventually becoming tolerable and finally relaxing me. Two days later still feeling good. I will continue to use the therapy balls as I get the flare ups. I feel that the balls are a good balance between hard and soft. I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Balls
customer_reviews.text: I love them, I purchased extra to put in my plate to give me the ability to relieve knots in other parts of my back. I would trade the relief I get now. Before my back would be in knots and I coudln't walk or lie down and get any rest, but now my sleep has improved so much.I definitely would recommend this product if you have sciatic nerve problems because it relieves deep tissue knots for a great relief.
customer_reviews.author: Stitch

customer_reviews.title: My physical therapist wasn’t wrong
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by both my physical therapist and a trainer at the gym. They both said the same things, 1. Hard enough to penetrate the tissue and work the muscle, 2. Soft enough that does leave bruising, and 3. Easily fits in the palm of your hand so that it is easy to use. They were right.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R

customer_reviews.title: Helps with post surgical pain and muscle tightness
customer_reviews.text: I needed an option for pain relief that is mobile and light weight to help me work out my tight muscles. I had surgery a month ago and one of my struggles is tight muscles. This product helps me be able to release my tightness in my trigger points in between physical therapy sessions and when I travel. I am able to have relief and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: T. Blake

customer_reviews.title: When your man isn't home for a back rub
customer_reviews.text: These massage balls take a little getting used to at first. They definitely feel like a massage chair once you get used to how to move around to do circular motion. I had back surgery just a little over a year ago and when it gets inflammed from over doing it, I can't move much for days after pain medications. The only thing that helps even faster is a massage so these massage balls work wonders! It would be nice to have a small book/pamphlet showing some different waya to use it but youtube can help as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie912

customer_reviews.title: Quality balls
customer_reviews.text: These work magic to all of my sore and aching muscles. I have shoulder impingements and constant knots in my glutes as well. I use these in addition to stretches to relieve these aches by rolling on them (quite painful but necessary) to continue my strenuous and constant workouts. Quality rubber feel.
customer_reviews.author: Noe Barrera

customer_reviews.title: No notable flaws
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for self massage, not sports, so I couldn't say how they do for playing Lacrosse. But they do an excellent job for massaging painful feet, and unlike the first one I bought they don't come apart when you bear down on them. The only thing that's less than perfect is that they pick up more dust and hair from the floor than the surface of the other ball... but the other ball ended up in the trash and these didn't.
customer_reviews.author: bicycledad

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: I had a sore neck and paid for several very expensive massage sessions which helped but did not totally resolve the problem because I could only go twice a week. Then I found these balls! I pressed them against the wall and rolling them against the knots in my neck fixed my neck in about a week. I used them several times a day. A massage therapist would have cost me a fortune if I tried to do the same! Ali Julia review
customer_reviews.author: Ali Julia

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Size is about a tennis ball, but much firmer. The outside is made of some sort of rubber substance, so it does have a smell. I like the outside though because it's just enough grip to keep it from sliding everywhere when I lie on it. Dust just suctions onto it though, but damp cloth is good enough to clean it off. If you're extremely hairy, you might want to cover up before using. The grip of the ball will yank. Tie up long hair~
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Great but picture misleading
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the two orange balls. The firmness is perfect. Much better that the squeaking dog ball I was using. I use on upper back shoulder blades and traps. Relieves knots and tight muscles. The only problem is that the picture was misleading. I thought I was getting two sizes. They are both the same.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Werner

customer_reviews.title: strong chemical-rubber odor
customer_reviews.text: they seem like they would work well but smell atrocious - beyond a mild rubber smell. i took one out of the bag and had to immediately put it back in. def can’t be safe to rub whatever is offgassing from these “massage balls” against one’s body. would not recommend, but if you are willing to put outside in the heat of summer for a potentially very long time to allow them to offgas, they may potentially release some/much of the chemicals and be safer.
customer_reviews.author: a.s.

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief almost immediately. Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband. He has had shoulder pain for months. Since using these to massage deep into the shoulder muscles his shoulder is much better. It has only been a few days and he is amazed at the pain relief already. We play sand volleyball almost every day and with the help of these massage balls he doesn't have to take time off.
customer_reviews.author: Aneesabb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rubber balls for a golden retriever!
customer_reviews.text: Lacrosse balls are hard rubber, bounce high and far, and roll forever . . . perfect for a dog that likes to chew and chase rubber balls. The hardness of the rubber makes them ideal for chewers, and my golden retriever likes to sit and move them around in his mouth because they are both heavy and firm. Downside: once you've introduced these balls into your dog's life, don't EVER take it to a Lacrosse game!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Jacques

customer_reviews.title: you can use them just about anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these massage balls. As someone with chronic pain, I have found these to be a life saver. Before I bought these, I was using tennis balls and I would quickly destroy them and have to replace them. These, however are still just as firm as the day I bought them. You can use them on feet, hands, arms, legs, back... basically anywhere you have tight muscles you can roll them out with these. For how much I use them, these have been an amazing purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great value, much cheaper than purchasing an actual lacrosse ball. I was curious about doing myofascial release for the plantar foot after reading and hearing about it on a podcast. While a quick search showed me that lacrosse balls are about $20+, these are a quarter the price and do the job: they're both hard enough and pliable enough to enable me to really work out those kinks. I didn't think I'd have this much to say about these massage balls, but there you have it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great hard balls
customer_reviews.text: Got these after my Sport-Chiro Doc said to use these at home for physical therapy and I love them! I had softer ones with varying firmness but favor these because they are very hard. Please note that I ask for firm deep tissue massages! These work great to roll out my knots by my shoulder blades, I use it on my foot for plantar fasciitis, I roll it on my forearm for tennis elbow! (I know...I’m totally jacked up!)
customer_reviews.author: San Di

customer_reviews.title: a great value and an integral part of my day after ...
customer_reviews.text: I work in a brewery and continuously develop knots in my shoulders and arms due to repetitive motion for 8-10 hours each shift. These balls have been a godsend for working out kinks and pain after a long day, and have greatly diminished my soreness. There is a distinct rubber smell, but it is not strong enough to notice without having them a few inches from your nose. They do bounce a little, so be wary if you live in an apartment and happen to drop them on hardwood flooring (sorry, neighbor!) Overall, a great value and an integral part of my day after a long shift at work.
customer_reviews.author: Toefoo

customer_reviews.title: Yaaaas!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I keep one at home and one at work. I have chronic back pain and these are helpful for pushing out knots. I also use them on my hip and under my feet. It's best to use while laying on a hard surface; remember to move SLOWLY! It's important to protect your muscles while you're rolling on the ball. You only need to use small movements too. I have been enjoying using these and think they're helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Bought for sciatic relief exercise
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after my doctor thought my severe back to leg pain was sciatic related. I saw videos online where PTs used massage balls like these to loosen some areas which might be pressing the sciatic nerves. These worked great and I have to say the pain in my sciatic is also better. But be forewarned these are rock hard and if your need something with a little bit of give, than these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nisey

customer_reviews.title: For myofascial release the size and material of these balls are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: While some people may prefer balls that aren't as rigid as these, they are perfect for me. I do a lot of back exercise, (back development is highly neglected by a lot of people) in part because I'm an artist who sits a lot while working, thus I require a balance. I find the size of these balls to be ideal. I stand against a wall or lay on the floor with a ball in proper position in order to apply pressure as I carefully move around to various areas on my back and along the sides of my spine. GREAT product.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Helps with pain, but uncomfortable at first
customer_reviews.text: These things are a great fix for sore muscles and even stuff backs. First day I had mine onsued them to I think crack my back. I heard and felt popping and pressure release from my spine and instantly felt better. They also work great to roll out muscles. A little painful to use a first since I wasn't use to it, but it's getting better every use
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: A Wellness Life Changer!
customer_reviews.text: I love sports but I'll admit I've never played lacrosse before. However, I'm beyond thankful for the sport for gifting us with such perfect tool to help relieve tension in the body. I travel with one of these balls and after a long day of travels I'll roll the ball under the arches of my feet to relax my feet. It's also great to stretch your toes as well. The real winner is using this ball on your back, behind your shoulder blades and on your traps. save yourself some money. You won't need a masseuse anymore.
customer_reviews.author: BYU Cougar

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Balls
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They are good to self-roll on sore spots, hands, fingers, wrists, elbows, arms, neck, shoulders. If laid on a flat surface, one can adjust sore spots on top of it for deeper pressure to release tightened muscles. I rolled a ball on my head when I felt a migraine coming on; it prevented the headache from becoming full blown, which was more than one can ever hope for.
customer_reviews.author: Marie M.

customer_reviews.title: So far they seem to be helping my lower back pain and I am pleased with their quality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I have watched several you tube videos on how to properly use these Lacrosse balls. So far they seem to be helping my lower back pain and I am pleased with their quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for leg pain during long drives
customer_reviews.text: Middle age ? Long drives? Leg cramps or pain? Get the these. I convinced my husband to quit complaining and start using tennis balls as he drove his hour plus commutes and he started to see relief in his leg pain - so I upgraded to these and they are more durable than a tennis ball, and a good step up on the deeper tissue scale.
customer_reviews.author: Dellaj

customer_reviews.title: Stress or Pain Relief
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kieba Massage balls not knowing what to expect. And now I’m glad I did. I use one for gripping as a stress ball. However, the benefits of using both massage balls for pain relief is just as effective. The ball is made out of a hard rubber so you don’t have to worry about damage due to wear-and-tear. In short, it’s an inexpensive alternative to either pain relief or, as in my case, stress release. This is not a paid advertisement/ fake post. I do recommend. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Eh... may work for some but too hard for back
customer_reviews.text: These are actually too hard. I have been using massage balls for a long time and these are just too hard with hardly any give. I used Acupoint massage balls in past they are also hard but provide a slight give so they are less aggressive. Product itself arrived well, shipping was good and customer service was good as I inquired about returning these because they do not work for me. 2 stars simply for the actual usefulness of the product as I will likely just throw them away since $10 is likely not worth my time to return.
customer_reviews.author: Giancarlo

customer_reviews.title: Throw away the tennis balls!
customer_reviews.text: Throw away your tennis balls and buy these!! I promise you'll love them! They are my new best friend and I use them every day. I struggle with chronic and severe pain and these have been an amazing help to me!
customer_reviews.author: Can Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Snap, Crackle, Pop - Oh, what a relief it is!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to mix my jingles, but that’s the song my feet sing when I use these balls. My search for the perfect ball for my feet has now officially ended. I had come close before, but these are just right. They are so good, I have to remind myself not to overdue using them. Obviously, I would recommend that you get a set for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Surfwalkerhhi

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.  Great value.
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. My dog commandeered the red one, so they make great dog toys, too. But every morning as I check my e-mail, Facebook, etc - I use the blue one on my feet. Just incredible. Go buy a set. No, I wasn't having any foot issues at all, but wow - you want happy feet - less than $10 for these. Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: daveonbass

customer_reviews.title: Helps with pain
customer_reviews.text: Yes this is a round slightly soft mostly hard ball. Helps a great deal with sciatica I put it in my back pocket when I sit down it keeps it in place.You can also place it at the point of pain leaning against a wall and roll it around.I use it for back pressure points also. Google pressure points go to image and see where the pressure points are. Good Luck✌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: My back is always hurting so bad and Im always asking my man to give me massage and one day he bought me a Shiatsu Back Massager but didn’t really worked for me until it stopped working! I’ve been always looking for something that can actually work and I finally found this little ball massager! I can’t get enough of these and it’s so addicting when you can feel pain and pleasure at the same time!!! The best part about this is it’s super cheap but does a really good job!
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: amazing massage balls
customer_reviews.text: it's so amazing for a deep tissue massage i feel the lacrosse massage balls hitting trigger points very nice, lacrosse balls help me to remove the stress and tension that I have in my upper back and shoulders and neck this is a very worthy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Quality/Value
customer_reviews.text: These come 2 to a pack. (I had previously purchased 2) I like to keep one in my car, one near my desk and one near my recliner, this way I can work on the knots in my leg while waiting for a light to change in the car or if I'm the passenger, sitting on it for glute release or to take a standing break at my desk and use the ball against the wall to roll my hip...and in my recliner to roll on my leg while watching TV and one in my gym bag for quick massage before workout. This helps to keep "trigger points" in my muscles lengthened to ease pains from overuse.
customer_reviews.author: Dona Turgeon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for those who suffer from tendonitis and plantar fasciitis especially when you put them in the fridge before using to help ice the soreness while massaging out the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Absolute necessity for anyone needing deep tissue massage
customer_reviews.text: Traveling? Home alone? Maybe just can't stand human contact? Get these. They make for great deep tissue massage (lower back for me). Coincidentally used for playing Lacrosse, they also happen to be perfectly engineered to roll around on your own to make your dog look at you like you're molesting his new chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: VS1979

customer_reviews.title: Good for myofascial pain
customer_reviews.text: I have severe neck and back problems from an accident and as a recently have frequent knots that are difficult to work out. I like how these balls are small and easy to roll around on and target areas close to the spine that a foam roller can’t. They are just firm enough with the tiniest bit of give. I even keep one at work for my upper and lower back and use in my chair.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Pain no more
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these! They got me through training in the Army since my shoulders hurt so bad. Now that I'm out, I use them on my feet after a long day. Perfect for rolling out smaller spots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pain relief! Harder than a tennis ball but not too hard like a golf ball would be
customer_reviews.text: I use it to take rid of stiff muscles and inflammation (I workout almos everyday). A tennis ball would be too soft while a golf ball would be too hard. Those balls are perfect for my goals: hard but with that tiny softness that allows to hold the pressure into the muscles. Easy to clean and I can take them with me everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my lower back.
customer_reviews.text: I know everyone is a different but for me these work great when i get a back spasm. I keep one at work and one a home and helps me relax the spasm when I massage it. I used to use a tennis ball but it would lose its firmness and become soft. This is full rubber and should maintain its firmness. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Massage Ball
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for massaging feet and calf muscles. They’d probably also be good for the back and legs. They’re very firm, so go easy in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: SWeberful

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up !
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting in those spots that need some kinks worked out and for pain relief! The only thing I would say is be aware they do stick to hair Great for getting in those spots that need some kinks worked out and for pain relief! The only downfall is THEY WILL STICK TO AND RIP OUT ANY HAIR when you move !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Good value
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good size and value for what I need. Made of good “rubber-like” material that’s not too painful when using it for trigger points in the body Cons: has a slight “rubber” smell, which I hope will go away.
customer_reviews.author: KAI

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed, perfect for reaccuring neck and back pain
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect! I have been experiencing pain and kinks in my neck for years now, every since having children. Randomly came across these while shopping for something else and I could not be happier with my purchase. So easy to use and right away felt relief. This will be something I use on a regular basis now to keep my back and neck from hurting. The balls seem to be made of a good quality rubber and are a perfect size for my back. Highly recommend if you are having similar pain.
customer_reviews.author: laurie percival

customer_reviews.title: Great by!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer From up you back problems especially with my sciatica and this really made it a lot easier for me to massage the pinch to area and provide relief. I did expect them to be a little bit bigger by in the end the size was good as well as all the other uses I can use them for to massage other knots on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Kieba Massage Lacrosse Balls - Kind relief for tight muscles
customer_reviews.text: Kieba Massage Balls are good because they are firm but not too hard...kind of like the pressure of a good massage therapist's thumbs but not so hard that it hurts. It takes some practice, I'm learning, but I am already getting relief from tight muscles in my low back, buttocks and around my hips. Delivery from this supplier was FAST.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia S. Brandes

customer_reviews.title: My trainer at the gym recommended that I get a lacrosse ball to massage my ...
customer_reviews.text: My trainer at the gym recommended that I get a lacrosse ball to massage my tight shoulders. I love these because I can use them to pinpoint where the tightness is and really focus the massage there. I use them either laying on the floor or standing against a wall. These balls can really dig into my tight muscles and help loosen them.
customer_reviews.author: twin2

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! WHAT A RELIEF!!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked as how good the kieba massage balls are! I kept one at my desk since my back is always aching. Very good product! I originally bought it for our upcoming trip and being a 10hr flight this will definitely release the back ache. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great for massaging. I bought these for my labor/delivery and they really came in handy to ease my contractions. My husband used these a lot on my back before and after pregnancy to help loosen the tension in my back and ease the pain. They seem to provide just the right amount of pressure to work out tension in my back without causing additional pain.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Thank you balls
customer_reviews.text: Effective especially in hard to reach places that a foam roller can't reach. Triceps, biceps, shoulders, traps. Can even be used as a substitute for a foam roller, at least for those who need more pressure. Very convenient to bring in a bag and use it along with travel or work. Bless these balls.
customer_reviews.author: jinha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Fetch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lacrosse balls to play fetch with my dog. They are perfect, lots of bounce, really well made and seem to be holding up great so far! I have no idea how they are for muscle knots and pain relief but would highly recommend them for fetch. They are reasonably priced too!
customer_reviews.author: Janey

product_meta.title: Kieba Massage Lacrosse Balls for Myofascial Release, Trigger Point Therapy, Muscle Knots, and Yoga Therapy. Set of 2 Firm Balls
product_meta.description:
Experience the ultimate personal massage tool with the Kieba Trigger Point Therapy Massage Lacrosse Balls.
Roll away knots and tension in your back, shoulders, neck, hips, arms, legs, buttocks, thighs, and feet. Perfect for all areas of the body.

The solid rubber construction is designed for many benefits:
- Trigger Point Therapy
- Myofascial Release
- Relieves Muscle Knots and Tight Muscles
- Recovery and Rejuvenation of Sore Muscles
- Relieves Stress and Tension
- Alleviates Cramps and Kinks
- Generates Blood Flow and Increases Flexibility
- Perfect for Yoga Therapeutics
feature_bullets: IMMEDIATE BENEFITS - Self myofascial release eliminates muscle knots and tension. Trigger point therapy massage lacrosse balls relieve sore and tight muscles to rejuvenate and revitalize all areas of the body.
EASY TO USE - Simply lean on the massage ball and use your own body weight and gravity to relieve muscle knots and tension.

MASSAGE ANYWHERE - Perfect for use while sitting on any chair, laying in bed, on the floor, or on a yoga mat. Use them at home, at the office, or at the gym. Small, portable and easy to bring along on any trip.
DURABLE - 100% Solid Rubber Construction. Official size and weight makes it great for lacrosse practice.

100% MONEY BACK GUARANTEE - If you are not 100% satisfied with your purchase of the Kieba Premium Massage Balls, simply return them within 30 days for a no-questions-asked full refund! Buy with confidence!
